5D74851009FD48A99A715B1ABB475720.description: Evaluate if formal or informal speech is appropriate in the context of a given situation

DD6F544E652D457D988ABD61C4EF9E13.description: Distinguish between formal and informal speech

B1F9D6DADCEB4AFEBC273744CB5911F1.description: Use multimedia components/visual displays to clarify information

F3ADD816E8934D6186CD8481B70C38F6.description: Determine what multi media and visual displays to clarify claims and findings.

CCCDCB7BA8114A03B9B08A1BE24BE487.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, sound) and visual
displays in presentations to clarify information.

24944B940C354500A4BA981CFBEC7134.description: Use appropriate eye contact, volume, and clear pronunciation

D10ED3D80B71493DAE515D022D903EC9.description:
Determine logical sequence and pertinent descriptions to support main ideas and
themes

F43A7ADCC25F4875A58F1DD6AC916110.description: Explain findings, claims, descriptions, facts, and details

C4B4E8B0219D4C59BB4B08A660D0315C.description:
Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent
descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes; use appropriate eye
contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

6B14060A099B4393BDFC976507DD1674.description: Analyze a speaker’s argument and specific claims

246BC1C07C6F4740938AE14BA2B6AB3E.description: Distinguish between supported and unsupported claims

A9FB60BF1BA2436E8B2522EAC8297ABE.description: Define and identify arguments, claims, reasons, and evidence

B6770958527744929DF3E183540CF188.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are
supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

37D1685A8AA648B595EEE2136D5A5FA2.description: Explain how information contributes to a topic, text, or to an issue

9AD6ED6295F045BF9112F589D2A03720.description: Interpret information presented in various media and formats

D1F01A6FF3D94B5B94CB69B05339E0B9.description:
Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually,
quantitatively, orally) and explain how it contributes to a topic, text, or issue under study.

F3690A1A5E1D4F16BDE6EF62FE2403C5.description: Paraphrase and reflect on multiple perspectives posed in discussions

A4DE3E1A9C6F4110960EDB2A7F8F7790.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple
perspectives through reflection and paraphrasing.

C7A0436B557D4C598059DD25572186C3.description: Pose and respond to specific questions to elaborate

CC963EF52E0640D7AC8190EE16D21DA8.description: Formulate comments, questions, and responses based on discussion

6F6BF8843D9249789F10EC71E71FAD81.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making
comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.

C79CE7911D8146D89EC619B50100B6CA.description: Collaborate to set goals and deadlines

B0C2C7863385462BBBCE622E0B3E9C20.description: Explain the rules and individual roles as needed for particular discussions

4AE1F4384F8F48C8A54DDF92C66C076E.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and
define individual roles as needed.

F546653B1B984A0DAB385BD3C901F2AB.description: Use prepared materials to probe and reflect ideas to advance the discussion

43C54595B6C14A63B6501B290B9F359C.description: Identify key ideas from reading material

2A40C8BC73CE4074A5D4BF0246132E43.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups,
and teacherled) with diverse partners on grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on
others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

712E518464214CF398C96F63F7706D10.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domainspecific
words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or
phrase important to comprehension or expression.

4C5F0A267AA24429BF70D7317DC6E7B4.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar
denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

731FDF9ACDA041F9A8086DC51065A544.description: Identify the relationship between particular words

0D4C397C5D2D441D8B7CB959FE4BC1B6.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole,
item/category) to better understand each of the words.

7B93E8368D2247ACAD57F16A80763ADB.description: Identify different types of figures of speech in context

BE1AE539E976435492763FFB2666C6DF.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.

61D97AE0F99345F095F81208DF3C0089.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and
nuances in word meanings.

0F8C8040CB5847359AE33BE25A4E6AC1.description:
Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by
checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

5DFABCEA1DA64328B77EDD2BCF7FC2DB.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both
print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its
precise meaning or its part of speech.

C4397570596B46B785ABCC9961223896.description: Identify common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots

64371BE0FACD4753BC564D14A6DBDCC3.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the
meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

9A91901CFA9B48349D5171BA3B9FB538.description: Identify context clues to determine the meaning of words or phrases

441679CD03C3495E8A641A3B42691425.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s
position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

0CE50AEA89C54BCF9EB8DB832A8977A0.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and
phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of
strategies.

20E0BFEE2B554977BAD01E0227F1A6C1.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.

362929C5A6CB4DDC8E61F8F96EF0A415.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

F3AC1901A2CC445489A27A9223723DDE.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or
listening.

76ADF0B5194542DEAED66773DA40468F.description: Identify the use of parenthese and dashes

83F2B294FACD46F3B9E187FC60C04628.description:
Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off
nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

86124463819A471492DADF3CD5823A96.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

A548928BE1DA4DE5BA2EF4A5F65D7BAE.description:
Recognize variations from standard English in their own and others’ writing and
speaking, and identify and use strategies to improve expression in conventional
language.

4D58AB676E0B419DA2F39221EA4F3741.description:
Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous
antecedents).

ADECDB01FFD0470EB7F4DFD085512D6A.description: Indentify shifts in pronoun number and person

72FB70626F8742368D2D4AC5689D4A38.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.

541C1F4D01104D12A79818667C3953CE.description: Identify pronoun case: subjective, objective, possessive

D201FE3218B14A90ACC8AFA74CEC94D5.description: Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

FA603E6561C549BA915B0DC8A1BC2FB2.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage
when writing or speaking.

6F89AE6528FD48489EDD235955B28F2E.description: Determine when to write for short or extended time frames

DDF6C9CD941F4667AE12B9C3043D6956.description: Identify task, purpose, and audience for various types of writing

C39F1E570C2F4B60BB677AE7CD724A8C.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of
discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

F2C81CB7CEC7419D9C1E2C9B48ACA106.description:
Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Trace and evaluate
the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are
supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not”).

CA5BDE8CD595457A91486006C9EC040D.description:
Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast texts
in different forms or genres [e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and
fantasy stories] in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics”).

6E4EB1A4935E4C23953B555E60E3673F.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research.

BCB885CF7C094F518FDDD75C0A80AF2B.description: Quote or paraphrase and credit sources to avoid plagiarism

4E4848C98007408494A04AF22800D083.description: Assess the credibility of each source

8D8ED47C08B44B918544FB34F83B45A2.description: Recognize credibility and accuracy of print and digital information and sources

6DD932A6D18F40F7AD8C39D22E698FCB.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the
credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others
while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

A9927DE3AAF1444E8FC86BEAFDED9652.description: Analyze information from multiple sources to narrow/refocus the inquiry

204CF381FA2C4EA1A22709A55A1D3F81.description: Examine research to distinguish relevant and irrelevant information.

7EE55CA8A6B5496DA021D9D836371E78.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources
and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

AFBD255D4A0240EB8BC407B7872E3C6A.description: Use keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting

7748F63752B342A7B69A3E34F4828E0C.description: Use technology to collaborate, produce, and publish writing

5192157F3D6243B68C79CA1ED932DA8B.description:
Evaluate technology tools, including the internet, for collaborating, producing, and
publishing writing

CF6141D48A5D425E885F739DA3711FE2.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as
to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient
command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

E06129D569E14B46B4A705FBEC7087D5.description:
Develop and strengthen writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new
approach

0A4805C8548D45A397C8E557A77B9982.description: Recognize how to plan, revise, edit, rewrite, and try a new approach

8135E180307049FEBA9ECD920109E6FB.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen
writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying
a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language
standards 1–3 up to and including grade 6.)

49F3947206F94FB09573039DC3738828.description: Use suitable idea development, organization and style strategies

BBBF6BE04E7C4AB6937D00E1445C34C8.description: Analyze the reason for writing to decide on task, purpose, or audience

61FAB93F590B4864A3BE7E2B62517E2B.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and
style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for
writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

9ACDB8BD9A544F2EA21F21C4BA02FFE3.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

44A130DA651D48F7AB912B72CCCB95F9.description: Use precise words, details, and language to develop experiences and events

99C72E968A82408697BEC1E91552F43E.description:
Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory
language to convey experiences and events.

7B8BDA6F15184B72BEB8B5B06AD508ED.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal
shifts

47E1DC33DE3B4B528F42F89381E5B106.description: Recognize how writers use transitional words to signal change

8E09C89655CD492896DE1C20AFA9E858.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and
signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

CF3F49764B4A4EE29AF3A6229FE59577.description: Use dialogue, pacing and description to develop experiences, events and characters

DBFF558E15344813B7712E2D3F3C8DFE.description: Analyze narrative techniques of dialogue, pacing, and description

BB74255D3F22464BB2FCA10E7BD96333.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop
experiences, events, and/or characters.

C29A636E066641C0A627C90A6743BD74.description: Use techniques to engage the reader and establish context

76CEE2AB03834C41AECB9869BEBF3DB6.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a
narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally
and logically.

9E5FD6689AE545EBB2BBE97CF4DE33FF.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

63C83CB213294D5F83C9B3E5A305AB8C.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or
explanation presented.

E2CA2E1A02A54B70B5059D3065862F3A.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

2681639FFDB64F6C99B8CE9C12FEE2D2.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

65B253D794AB4C0CADB167CDEF518EA0.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the
topic.

5172274A04964A9A98C1C80AEE1A1A54.description: Select precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform or explain

D51513B02330452C83113E7751DAF6AC.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain
the topic.

028F159E65564969AD857298CD2FDE36.description: Identify transitions that clarify idea and concept relationships

CD1B8B4A98264B2681170EB96220FA1C.description:
Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and
concepts.

F40486F1822549CAB082EB899FA1481D.description: Use formatting, graphics, and multimedia to aid comprehension

AB4C9BEC36654735A2350539F301FDDC.description:
Provide, organize and develop a topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details,
quotations, examples, and other information

64A9174A77E8446C8C259CD57531DFDE.description:
Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or
other information and examples.

4626FB88F4B0412AA0CE18E4B0A467FE.description: Integrate formatting, graphics, and multimedia to aid comprehension

4FFC92F0E6634DCD9CDE45401113D620.description:
Provide, organize and develop a topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details,
quotations, examples, and other information

0C562C939B2142F28C60033218F9FD84.description: Determine how to organize ideas, concepts, and information to aid comprehension

B29290AF095045238971AE8A3B052BE6.description: Determine when to include formatting, graphics, and multimedia to aid comprehension

74B6EE6CEB6548778F3E4431E659C05B.description:
Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies
such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include
formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when
useful to aiding comprehension.

10D9458FAA5844DD8FAD8E5B941A2FB5.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts,
and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

D12D3A323FDE4B00AB2AFEF01820BC07.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the argument
presented.

FE2A814E81A849469DD36E2DE341CCC1.description: Demonstrate and maintain a formal style

670BB88944314193A11F46E7EFC02A3F.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

30CAEAFE196540B89C7C87F27AEAD1B2.description: Explain the relationships among claims and reasons

BEAA0CF3BC9D40CD84B06A046AD75B63.description: Recognize words, phrases, and clauses showing relationships among claims

43D792FDCE824251AB8B1E22AA566603.description:
Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and
reasons.

82D93DB19D854932B280BAFF51A80D7B.description:
Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible
sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

DFB1B6DF297040F186E363253435F6F3.description: Organize claims and supportive reasons and evidence clearly

711EF1A118CA4D0CBA2643A55C24C425.description: Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence clearly.

EB6C5C83FA3B42BEB2E49B6F118EEF8A.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

A2EE419FCE1C4BEA869C637DD0A17797.description:
Read nonfiction literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently,with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range

983898B3B94E40F690CCE96E0EDCAB0E.description:
Comprehend nonfiction literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range

A8ACFD0E0DFE47C3A0C407C2E42D5B7C.description:
By the end of year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6-8 text
complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

5972EE31F2C043C89927284926151A0C.description:
Read literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently with scaffolding as
needed at the high end of the range

1A0859F9A5FE41ADA4AA5B0BF1B8B9BE.description:
Comprehend literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently with scaffolding
as needed at the high end of the range

4CD9166A01E04558AD15A76BC92FE0AA.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas,
and poems, in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed
at the high end of the range.

DE85AEA3327C42D282FBE263DD860F81.description: Compare/contrast the events depicted by different authors in informational text

C98612FBAF3A4090A2DDB8F72F99E245.description: Identify events common in two or more texts in informational text

6F1BD07F27FD4733A746DB916540A0BB.description:
Compare and contrast one author's presentation of events with that of another (e.g.,
a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

3064ECADF3C949308CA4F8C83DB8222A.description: Distinguish claims that are supported by the text from those that are not

2A94186B1B71442BB2ECA7F9271726F6.description: Evaluate the argument and claims for support in informational text

912A6618DFDD41ECBA20C6F5F42670C9.description: Summarize the argument and specific claims in informational text

78579EC4C08C4CD59A6D027A8ADE724B.description: Identify reasons and evidence of claims in informational text

3E13E41A420249AB9CE18DADD5F97263.description: Recall arguments and claims in informational text

AFB5735A85D94A6DB57DB706DDFD5FF9.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims
that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

44B21CE21A954355A8FD44AEC3FCA076.description:
Demonstrate understanding of a topic using information from various media, formats, or
texts in informational text

82C8F968C9B749668101AEAA930DEDC2.description: Integrate information from various media, formats, or texts in informational text

FFD9BEFBB6C742B0AB204A2D841B63E2.description: Access information from different media, formats, or texts in informational text

5C3C991D6AF34D9297AFC57E1A212B38.description:
Integrate information presented in different media or a format (e.g., visually,
quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

BEDA00E39C0E4BC7B683C511C970C5A2.description:
Compare and contrast how stories of the same genre approach a similar theme and
topic

914AA1DEFA1041FC91040402257EEFE4.description: Analyze how stories of different genre approach a similar theme and topic

6B1696C64ACA42F09D61D3A2A4DD311C.description:
Compare and contrast what is seen/heard in a text when visually/auditory presented to
what is experienced when reading

EB0377F8B1CB4A1787C29502E199F1E4.description: Evaluate the value of multiple text formats: text, audio, visual, live performance

8ED9B27956304C92AA60EC6714B28102.description: Recognize the difference of multiple text formats: text, audio, visual, live performance

AE13FADDBDF0405B97AA032776C70A5B.description:
Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to
listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting
what they "see" and "hear" when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen
or watch.

AE2B1043CBD1463EA233054DEC8FECC8.description: Determine how the author conveys his/her point of view in informational text

49BA9F4D01E949A6A0978BC358A77B64.description:
Identify details or examples for developing the point of view or purpose in informational
text

92BEF6B3C6524EB28618A8B31C37E675.description: Recognize the author’s point of view or purpose in informational text

7FD85EA3907F422BB06DF02A2EF1DC43.description:
Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is
conveyed in the text.

DF6D4A3819FF4BEA8F0CC57C956B0350.description:
Analyze how sentences, paragraphs, chapters, or sections contribute to idea
development in informational text

2EBBC0A973B4453BB2262D0833EB7287.description:
Analyze how particular sentences, paragraphs, chapters, or sections fit textual structure
in informational text

B7D5BE564FBB4B589A9C7BCD24A11A20.description:
Recognize text structure through chronology, comparison, cause/effect, and
problem/solution in informational text

EDA30E6248CF434DBAB56A50EC0C1EA1.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the
overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

F611C4F633644B0AB263A2F97FC51AF4.description:
Determine the meaning of figurative, connotative, and technical words and phrases in
informational text

A12413CDC727431F82C380B92660EB32.description: Identify figurative, connotative, and technical words and phrases in informational text

BD38AE0F79684519BCFD9EA099E8E655.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including
figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

0D8A92DEE59443DDA467BB89E8498E80.description: Explain how an author develops different points of view

4FC01C1573C748BF8AE8F636AD3027FC.description: Explain point of view through a narrator or speaker

F3D9DE352D874A4CABFC6B88B83B83C9.description: Recognize author’s strategies to develop point of view

99575932A5C4437EB333F1A50BF897A4.description: Identify details used to develop point of view

1C0CA80F90C64FC9B9143DBE5FB21274.description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of a narrator or speaker in a text.

DEBCA2FFDBA34AFE9067DBFC109165D1.description: Analyze how particular structure contributes to development of theme, setting, and plot

E1F32232C0FA418DB7A17639017B8538.description: Analyze how a sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text

8C1AFB7DE8CE43ACA4B246E782F1FD5F.description: Recognize the theme, setting, and plot

3D15525819BA49FD948516006C13EF29.description: Define the various structures of a literary text

9531F209DEA8445EA413ABA0761E67BF.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or a stanza fit into the overall
structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

8B6638218E2B440AA8ECB4C86AFE6FE0.description: Analyze the impact of word choice on meaning and tone

0214DB9F645949E79C515CEDBE7AFA96.description: Recognize meaning and tone in a text

FB6C09D2FEE64B27B242D865830D31DC.description: Identify figurative and connotative words and phrases

731200C1EA124B8194584ED51C4AC489.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including
figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on
meaning and tone.

C5A98F6B63BB4D3A84B150A7157D8370.description: Cite details of key individuals, events, ideas, or anecdotes

009F104009904AC9A299F07013B4FC25.description:
Analyze how key individuals, events, and ideas are introduced, illustrated, and
elaborated in informational text

2F3ADD28699D4E429B4C54345AE4CF9E.description: Identify key individuals, events, and ideas in informational text

28DE48D232234C80A0E48CFB5EE89016.description:
Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and
elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

A62D278459CD41A98FFB0B688D123AD0.description:
Summarize details supporting the central idea in a non-biased summary in informational
text

F8948F9DEC654A7CB96AB0959253BBF6.description: Recall central idea devoid of personal opinion and judgment in informational text

C7EAA2C65F684577A5A26705C03F8B50.description: Identify the central idea and particular details in informational text

F7ADFC80A60B4FD3B4926299611B49C4.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details;
provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgements.

BC59FCB04BC0423DBFF856DE4A1873DB.description: Cite textual evidence that supports inferences in informational text

657B08078FA84B25A47C0AF832748F7F.description: Summarize the evidence that supports explicit analysis and inferences in informational text
